questions.question:
Question 1: A study is conducted to find the relationship between the height and weight of school 
students. Which of the following would be useful in this study?
questions.explanation:
The coefficient of correlation can be used to determine the relationship between both variables in 
this scenario. It is used to express the strength and direction of the relationship between two 
variables. It is represented by the letter 'r'. Its value ranges from -1 to +1.

questions.question: Question 2: Which among the following is false about correlation?

options.a: It indicates the strength of relationship between 2 variables
options.b: Correlation coefficient of 1 indicates a linear relationship

questions.explanation:
A correlation between 2 variables only indicates the strength of the relationship between two 
variables, not causation. A correlation coefficient of 1 indicates a linear relationship. It cannot measure the risk.

questions.question:
Question 3: During a study conducted to assess the effect of smoking on life expectancy, the correlation 
coefficient was found to be 0.60. Calculate the coefficient of determination for this study.
questions.explanation:
The coefficient of determination (CD) for this study is 0.36 (36%). It is calculated by r2, where r is the correlation coefficient. In this study, the correlation coefficient 
(r) is 0.6. Hence CD = (0.6)2 = 0.36 The coefficient of determination refers to the percentage variability in one variable due to a 
change in the other variable. In the above study, a coefficient of determination of 0.36 means 
that 36% of the variation in life expectancy is accounted for by smoking.

questions.question: Question 4: What is the best way to study relationship between two variables?
questions.explanation:
A scattergram/ scatter plot is the best way to study the relationship between 2 variables. The following image shows a scatter plot. 874 
Sold by @itachibot The following image shows a forest plot. The following image shows a funnel plot. 875 
Sold by @itachibot The following image shows a frequency polygon.

questions.question:
Question 5: A psychiatry resident is conducting a study to assess the relationship between prefrontal 
blood flow under cognitive load and the severity of psychotic symptoms in schizophrenic 
patients. He calculates the correlation coefficient as -1.24. You can therefore conclude that:

options.a: Prefrontal blood flow is a good predictor of the severity of psychotic symptoms
options.b: Prefrontal blood flow accounts for most of the variance in symptoms
options.c: Schizophrenia causes low prefrontal blood flow
options.d: The correlation coefficient has been calculated incorrectly

questions.explanation:
In this scenario, the correlation coefficient (r) of -1.24 is incorrect, as 'r' can only lie between -1 to 
+1.

questions.question:
Question 6: In a random sample of 5000 corporate workers, the correlation coefficient of work 
satisfaction and life expectancy was found to be +0.7 with a p-value of 0.01. What is your 
interpretation?

options.a: Work satisfaction does not improve life expectancy
options.b: Strong statistically significant positive association between the variables
options.c: 70% people who enjoy work will live longer
options.d: 30% people who do not enjoy work will have a shorter life expectancy

questions.explanation:
The above study is statistically significant (p-value = 0.01) and indicates a strong positive 
correlation (correlation coefficient = +0.7) between work satisfaction and life expectancy. 876 
Sold by @itachibot Correlation is a measure of the statistical association of the variables, not a causal relationship. Here, the coefficient of determination (r2) = 0.7 x 0.7 = 0.49. This means that 49% of the 
variation in life expectancy can be explained by satisfaction at work.

questions.question:
Question 7: A group of cardiologists found a correlation coefficient of 0.90 (p-value = 0.01) between the 
systolic BP and serum cholesterol levels of patients attending their clinics. Which of the 
following statements is an incorrect interpretation of this study?

options.a: The magnitude of systolic BP and serum cholesterol levels are closely related
options.b: A patient with a high systolic BP is likely to have high serum cholesterol
options.c: A patient with a low systolic BP is likely to have low serum cholesterol
options.d: 80% of the variation in BP can be explained by serum cholesterol and vice versa

questions.explanation:
Correlation is an indicator of the strength and direction of the relationship between 2 variables, 
not the magnitude. The given study is statistically significant (p-value = 0.01) with a strong positive correlation (r = 
+0.90) between systolic BP and cholesterol levels. Thus, it is likely that patients with high systolic 
BP will have high cholesterol levels and those with low BP will have low cholesterol levels. The coefficient of determination (r2)here is 0.9 x 0.9 = 0.81. This indicates that around 80% of 
the variation in systolic BP among the patients can be explained by serum cholesterol levels.

questions.question:
Question 8: 868 
Sold by @itachibot Among the given options, what can be the likely value of the coefficient of correlation 
between infant mortality rate and economic status?
questions.explanation:
Among the given options, the coefficient of correlation between infant mortality rate and 
economic status (r) is likely to be -0.8. It is known that low economic status is associated with a high infant mortality rate. This indicates 
a negative correlation. However, the infant mortality rate is also influenced by other factors, 
indicating a moderate correlation (not equal to 1). This makes -0.8 the most likely value of 
correlation.

questions.question:
Question 9: High salt intake in individuals is associated with high blood pressure. What type of 
correlation is this?
questions.explanation:
An increase in blood pressure with salt intake is an example of a positive correlation. The association of decreased life expectancy with increased smoking is an example of negative 
correlation.

questions.question:
Question 10: A scattergram was plotted as shown below to study the relationship between two variables. 
What is the correct interpretation?

options.a: There is correlation between both variables and the Pearson’s coefficient is 1
options.b: There is correlation between both variables and the Pearson’s coefficient is – 1
options.c: There is non-linear correlation between both variables
options.d: There is no association between both variables

questions.explanation:
The given scattergram depicts a non-linear correlation between the two variables. Correlation expresses the strength and direction of the relationship between two variables in 
terms of a correlation coefficient. There are two types of correlation coefficients: Pearson coefficient 
Spearman coefficient Used for data withcontinuous

questions.question: Question 11: What conclusion can be drawn from the following scattergram?

options.a: There is a perfect negative correlation between the two variables
options.b: There is a high positive correlation between the two variables
options.c: There is a high negative correlation between the two variables
options.d: There is a perfect positive correlation between the two variables

questions.explanation: The given scattergram shows a high negative correlation between the two variables.

questions.question: Question 12: The value of one parameter can be estimated from another related parameter by:
questions.explanation:
The value of one parameter can be estimated from another related parameter by using regression 
techniques.

questions.question:
Question 13: If correlation is given by the equation y = a + bx, what would be the nature of the graph? 870 
Sold by @itachibot
questions.explanation: The equation, y = a + bx indicates a straight line.

questions.question: Question 14: Look at the image below and select the linear regression equation corresponding to the graph.
questions.explanation:
Among the given options, the equation y=11+2x corresponds to the linear regression equation of 
the form y= + x. When 2 variables are correlated, such that the dependent variable is represented on the y-axis and 
the independent variable on the x-axis, then the value of y can be obtained by using the linear 
regression equation y =  + x, where: y - dependent variable  - intercept  - slope of the line x - independent variable In the equation y=11+2x, the intercept() = 11, while the slope of the line () = 2. Option A: y=10-x, represents an intercept of 10, and a slope of -1 indicating a negative correlation. 
However, the given image shows a positive correlation. Options B and D: They do not fit the linear regression equation of the form y =  + x.

questions.question:
Question 15: In a study, the total cholesterol was calculated as a + b■x■ + b■x■ + b■ x■, where x■ 
indicates calorie intake, x■ indicates physical activity, and x■ indicates body mass index. 
What is this an example of?
questions.explanation:
878 
Sold by @itachibot The given equation of y = a + b1x1 +b2x2…..bnxn is an example of multiple linear regression. In this equation: b1, b2…..bn represent different regression coefficients x1, x2…….xn represent the known variables

questions.question:
Question 16: An epidemiologist has determined five independent factors influencing the outcome of a 
particular disease. Which of the following statistical methods can he use to compare these 
factors?
questions.explanation:
In this scenario, the outcome to be determined (dependent variable) is the occurrence of the 
disease, which is categorical (qualitative) in nature. Logistic regression can be used when a 
categorical dependent variable is being compared with either a categorical or numerical 
independent variable. Linear regression is used when the outcome is numerical. Dependent variable (outco 
me) Independent variable(risk 
factors, exposure) Qualitative (categorical) 
Quantitative (numeric 
al) Linear regressionT-testA 
NOVA Qualitative (categorical) 
Logistic regressionChi-squ 
are Quantitative (numerical) 
Logistic regression 
Linear regression

questions.question: Question 17: What test is used to compare Kaplan-Meier survival curves?
questions.explanation:
The Cox proportional hazards test is used to compare Kaplan-Meier survival curves. Survival analysis is used for analyzing the expected duration of time until one event occurs, such 
as death. The following methods are used for this are: • Life table analysis • Kaplan-Meier analysis - it involves calculating the survival function (the probability that a person 
will survive past a certain time) Life tables and survival functions are graphically represented in a Kaplan-Meier plot or curve.

questions.question: Question 18: Which of the following is not used to compare survival curves?
questions.explanation:
Fisher’s exact test is not used to compare survival curves. The following tests are used to compare 
the survival curves or Kaplan-Meier curves: • Mantel-Haenszel test • Log-rank test 879 
Sold by @itachibot • Cox regression or Cox proportional hazards analysis

questions.question: Question 19: What is the Spearman coefficient used to determine?
questions.explanation:
Spearman coefficient is used to determine correlation. It is used to find linear or non-linear 
relationships for data with discrete ordered intervals. Pearson correlation coefficient is used to find linear relationships for data with continuous 
intervals.

questions.question:
Question 20: A researcher wants to compare a newly developed test for COVID with the gold standard test. 
Which of the following methods can he use?
questions.explanation:
The Bland-Altmann analysis is used for comparing a newly developed test with another test, 
which usually is the gold standard. This method involves the graphical construction of a 
Bland-Altmann plot which is used to compare the measurements from both methods. 880 
Sold by @itachibot Facets of Clinical Research and Biostatistics
